subject: RE: [junit] Re: junit.swingui is not found in the jar
msgSnippet: Dear Cas, We got out of the UI business because 1) the user interface was covered by the IDEs and Ant and 2) user interfaces required a lot of support work.
messageBody:
Dear Cas,

We got out of the UI business because 1) the user interface was covered by
the IDEs and Ant and 2) user interfaces required a lot of support work.

Regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
cas_nixster
Sent: Wednesday, March 19, 2008 4:08 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: junit.swingui is not found in the jar



--- In junit@yahoogroups. <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> com, "hovh03"
<hovh03@...> wrote:
>
>
> Is this package deprecated? I couldn't find information anywhere
> about this. Please tell me what is going on.
>

I would use the word "gone" instead of deprecated. JUnit 4 does not
ship with either the swingui or the awtui runners. (I am not going to
miss the classloader craziness that occasionally popped up with the
swingui in 3.8.)

I have not seen an official explanation for this, but just hazarding a
guess, I would expect that it is the result of a couple of things.

One, the majority of users are obtaining graphical results from their
IDEs or via an Ant report task. For automated testing, the textui
serves very well.

Two, the JUnit developers have put a lot of work in the 4.4 release.
It's quite possible that there simply hasn't been the necessary time
to create a swingui for 4.4.

rgds,
cas






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
